label: 横穴古墳
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: A mounded tomb with a corridor entrance, in contrast with tombs entered from the top, or tateana kofun. Early mounded tombs in Japan were generally constructed in tateana style; by the fifth century, tombs were given corridor entrances. [竪穴古墳]
